attributes.action: Give people the right not to have a bank account
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Restore the right of people to have wages and benefits paid either in cash or drafts not requiring processing by banks.
The ordinary citizen is virtually powerless when dealing with banks. They have to accept whatever conditions and charges the bank sees fit to impose and the fact that other agencies can access and control bank accounts seems like an infringement of their human rights.
As an example: pensioners in Scotland can have their accounts frozen by Sheriff's Officers acting on Summary Warrants which are not appealable and granted without the opportunity of contesting them.
This can result in people being denied access to the basic necessities of life as defined in the European Convention of Human Rights.
All organisatioms should have processes to handle monetary transactions without resorting to banks.
Those who wish a bank account will still be able to have one.
